BELGRADE & ndash ; The United Nations World Food Programme ( WFP ) today sent a second batch of emergency relief items to Serbia where severe floods have affected some 600,000 people , following the heaviest rains the Balkans have witnessed in 120 years .

RelatedSentence: The shipment includes water tanks , generators and inflatable boats provided by WFP and the Norwegian Government .

At the request of the Red Cross , WFP is also preparing to dispatch from the UNHRD in Dubai High - Energy Biscuits and ready - to - eat food to help 7,000 flood - affected people in Serbia .
WFP responded to the emergency within less than 36 hours sending non-food relief items ; the first UN assistance to arrive in the country following widespread flooding and landslides .
